resource.name: Iowa Liquor Sales
resource.description:
This dataset contains the spirits purchase information of Iowa Class “E” liquor licensees by product and date of purchase from January 1, 2012 to current.  The dataset can be used to analyze total spirits sales in Iowa of individual products at the store level.

Class E liquor license, for grocery stores, liquor stores, convenience stores, etc., allows commercial establishments to sell liquor for off-premises consumption in original unopened containers.
resource.attribution: Iowa Department of Revenue, Alcoholic Beverages
columns_description: Address of store who ordered the liquor.
Date of order
Total volume of liquor ordered in gallons. (i.e. (Bottle Volume (ml) x Bottles Sold)/3785.411784)
Total cost of liquor order (number of bottles multiplied by the state bottle retail)
The number of bottles of liquor ordered by the store
The amount the store paid for each bottle of liquor ordered
The amount that Alcoholic Beverages Division paid for each bottle of liquor ordered
The number of bottles in a case for the liquor ordered
Description of the individual liquor product ordered.
Item number for the individual liquor product ordered.
Category of the liquor ordered.
Category code associated with the liquor ordered
Iowa county number for the county where store who ordered the liquor is located

Location of store who ordered the liquor.  The Address, City, State and Zip Code are geocoded to provide geographic coordinates.  Accuracy of geocoding is dependent on how well the address is interpreted and the completeness of the reference data used.  Left NULL where unable to provide point location.
City where the store who ordered the liquor is located
Name of store who ordered the liquor.
Unique number assigned to the store who ordered the liquor.
Concatenated invoice and line number associated with the liquor order.  This provides a unique identifier for the individual liquor products included in the store order
County where the store who ordered the liquor is located
Total volume of liquor ordered in liters.  (i.e. (Bottle Volume (ml) x Bottles Sold)/1,000)
Volume of each liquor bottle ordered in milliliters.
The vendor name of the company for the brand of liquor ordered
The vendor number of the company for the brand of liquor ordered
Zip code where the store who ordered the liquor is located

resource.name: Insurance Companies Licensed in Iowa
resource.description: The Iowa Insurance Division regulates and supervises the business of insurance in Iowa.  This dataset provides a list of insurance companies licensed to do business in Iowa.
resource.attribution: Iowa Department of Insurance & Financial Services, Insurance
columns_description: Location based on alternate address.
Unique number assigned by the National Association of Insurance Commissioners (NAIC).
Name of insurance company.
Location based on company address.
Presents former names the company operated as.  Their name has changed due to re-branding, acquisitions or mergers.
Indicates whether company is owned by stockholders (stock) or policyholders (mutual).
Iowa Domiciled, whether the company is organized under Iowa law, is indicated by a check mark.  Check mark = true.  Null value = false.
A more detailed classification for the type of insurance company.
Unique number assigned by the Iowa Insurance Division.  Known internally as "active_code."

The federal government recently extended the permissible period of time for which short-term limited-duration health insurance policies can be issued.  There are different requirements for the plans depending on the length.  If a company offers you a plan for a period of 90 days or greater, there are a number of benefits that must be provided as part of the policy.   It is important to note that the plans that are shorter than 90 days may not provide comprehensive benefits and are unlikely to provide coverage for any pre-existing conditions you may have.
Type of insurance company:  Life, Health, Property Casualty, County Mutual, State Mutual, Benevolent, Fraternal, or MEWA (Multiple Employer Welfare Arrangements).

resource.name: Insurance Producers Licensed in Iowa
resource.description:
The Iowa Insurance Division is responsible for issuing licenses or authority for many types of regulated individuals dealing with insurance related products.  Individuals interested in becoming either a resident or non-resident insurance producer licensed in the state of Iowa need to apply through the National Insurance Producer Registry (NIPR) online system.  Those wishing to become a resident insurance producer licensed in the state of Iowa must successfully pass the appropriate Iowa producer licensing exam for that specific line of authority.

To add additional lines of authority, a resident or non-resident insurance producer licensed in the state of Iowa need to apply through the NIPR online system.  Resident insurance producers wishing to add a line of authority must successfully pass the appropriate Iowa producer licensing exam for that specific line of authority.

This dataset provides a listing of resident and non-resident insurance producers licensed to sell to Iowans.
resource.attribution: Iowa Department of Insurance & Financial Services, Insurance

resource.name: State of Iowa Salary Book
resource.description:
The dataset contains the name, gender, county or city of residence (when possible), official title, total salary received during each fiscal year, base salary for the employee, and traveling and subsistence expense reimbursed to state personnel beginning with Fiscal Year 2007.

A status of "TERMINATED" in the column providing the base salary does not indicate that the employee was fired, only that the person no longer works in that position.
resource.attribution: Iowa Department of Administrative Services, State of Iowa Salary Book
columns_description: Total travel & subsistance expenses reimbursed during Fiscal Year
Total salary paid during Fiscal Year
Position the state employee held during Fiscal Year
City or county where the state employee resides (where available)
Name of the employee
Department sub-agency or institution employing the individual (where applicable)
Department employing the individual
Annual, biweekly or hourly base salary for the employee
Gender of the employee
Fiscal year (July 1 - June 30) salary data is associated with
Date base salary was computed

domain_metadata.value: Some employees may show up multiple times where they were employed by more than one department during the fiscal year, reflecting their total salary paid twice.

The dataset contains information on personnel from all state government departments, boards, commissions, institutions, and Regents institutions (e.g. ISU, UNI and U of I) unless personnel receive an annual salary of less than one thousand dollars. Community Based Corrections officers and State Fair Board members are not included in the dataset.
Data is updated annually.  Updates are typically available in November.

resource.name: Sample 2023 Iowa Individual Affordable Care Act Premiums
resource.description:
This dataset provides sample premium information for individual ACA-compliant health insurance plans available to Iowans for 2023 based on age, rating area and metal level. These are premiums for individuals, not families. Explore and drill into the data using the 2023 Sample Premium Explorer.

Please note that not every plan ID is available in every county. On or after November 1, 2022, please go to www.healthcare.gov to determine if your plan is available in the county you reside in.
resource.attribution: Iowa Department of Insurance & Financial Services, Insurance
columns_name: Rating Areas for Iowa Individual Affordable Care Act Premiums
columns_description: Premium for Tobacco Users
Premium for Non-Tobacco Users
Name of the insurance plan for which premiums are associated with
Location associated with the center of the plan's rating area.
Counties within the rating area.
The age of the individual for which the premium applies. "14" means ages 0-14; "64" means ages 64 and older; the others mean the specific age listed.
A geographic area that all issuers in the state must uniformly use as part of their rate setting. Counties within the rating area are listed in the counties column.

Plan choices under the Affordable Care Act fall into five different categories or metal levels, i.e., bronze (60%), silver (70%), gold (80%), platinum (90%), and catastrophic (less than 60% -- generally limited to those under the age of 30). A silver plan (on average) would be expected to pay around 70% of healthcare expenses for a standard population. The individual, therefore, would pay about 30%.
ID give for the plan the premiums are associated with.

This column was automatically created in order to record in what polygon from the dataset 'Iowa House Districts' (k5un-inmm) the point in column 'rating_area_centroid' is located.  This enables the creation of region maps (choropleths) in the visualization canvas and data lens.

This column was automatically created in order to record in what polygon from the dataset 'Iowa Senate Districts' (6vzg-kjqr) the point in column 'rating_area_centroid' is located.  This enables the creation of region maps (choropleths) in the visualization canvas and data lens.

This column was automatically created in order to record in what polygon from the dataset 'Iowa Regional Zip Codes' (g8ff-h7ce) the point in column 'rating_area_centroid' is located.  This enables the creation of region maps (choropleths) in the visualization canvas and data lens.

This column was automatically created in order to record in what polygon from the dataset 'County Boundaries of Iowa' (y683-txed) the point in column 'rating_area_centroid' is located.  This enables the creation of region maps (choropleths) in the visualization canvas and data lens.
Health Maintenance Organization (HMO) or Exclusive Provider Organization (EPO)
Name of insurance company offering the plan.

resource.name: 2018 Iowa County Subdivisions
resource.description:
This dataset contains the county subdivisions in Iowa, which are the primary divisions of counties for the reporting of Census Bureau data. They include legally-recognized minor civil divisions (MCDs) and statistical census county divisions (CCDs), and unorganized territories.

TIGER/Line Shapefiles are extracted from the Census MAF/TIGER database by nation, state, county, and entity. Census MAF/TIGER data for all of the aforementioned geographic entities are then distributed among the shapefiles each containing attributes for line, polygon, or landmark geographic data.
resource.attribution: U.S. Department of Commerce, U.S. Census Bureau, Geography Division
columns_description: Water area within county subdivision in meters squared.
Land area within county subdivision in meters squared.

The GNIS for the county subdivision is taken from INCITS 446:2008 (Geographic Names Information System (GNIS)), Identifying Attributes for Named Physical and Cultural Geographic Features (Except Roads and Highways) of the United States, Its Territories, Outlying Areas, and Freely Associated Areas, and the Waters of the Same to the Limit of the Twelve-Mile Statutory Zone.  Field originally COUSUBNS in source file.

The FIPS is a concatenation of the state FIPS code, followed by the county FIPS code, followed by the county subdivision FIPS code. No spaces are allowed between the two codes. The State FIPS code is taken from "National Standard Codes (ANSI INCITS 38-2009), Federal Information Processing Series (FIPS) - States". The county FIPS code is taken from "National Standard Codes (ANSI INCITS 31-2009), Federal Information Processing Series (FIPS) - Counties/County Equivalents". The county subdivision FIPS code is taken from Federal Information Processing Series Census Codes for Named Populated Places, Primary County Divisions, and other Locational Entities of the United States, Puerto Rico, and the Island Areas (Formerly FIPS 55-3).  Field originally GEOID in source file.
County subdivision name
Name and the translated legal/statistical area description for county subdivision
Name of county the subdivision is located.  Derived from National Standard Codes (ANSI INCITS 31-2009), Federal Information Processing Series (FIPS) - Counties/County Equivalents.
Shape of the county subdivision

domain_metadata.value: The boundary information in the TIGER/Line Shapefiles are for statistical data collection and tabulation purposes only; their depiction and designation for statistical purposes does not constitute a determination of jurisdictional authority or rights of ownership or entitlement and they are not legal land descriptions.Coordinates in the TIGER/Line shapefiles have six implied decimal places, but the positional accuracy of these coordinates is not as great as the six decimal places suggest.
Data completeness of the TIGER/Line Shapefiles reflects the contents of the Census MAF/TIGER database at the time the TIGER/Line Shapefiles were created.

The TIGER/Line Shapefile products are not copyrighted however TIGER/Line and Census TIGER are registered trademarks of the U.S. Census Bureau. These products are free to use in a product or publication, however acknowledgement must be given to the U.S. Census Bureau as the source.

resource.name: Iowa Industrial New Jobs Training Contracts
resource.description:
The Iowa Industrial New Jobs Training (260E) program provides employers expanding Iowa’s workforce with new employee training. The 260E program is designed to increase worker productivity and company profitability, and is administered by Iowa's 15 community colleges and financed through bonds sold by the colleges. Depending on wages paid, the participating businesses divert 1.5% or 3% of the Iowa state withholding taxes generated by the new positions to the community college to retire the bonds. Businesses may also be eligible to receive reimbursement for their on-the-job training expenses, and/or corporate tax credits.
This dataset lists 260E contracts open in or after 2012, Qtr 2, and includes information on: the administering community college, participating employer, location of employment, training expenses, and employment information.
More on Iowa's 260E program.
resource.attribution: Iowa Economic Development Authority, Iowa Industrial New Jobs Training Program
columns_description: Number of employees at employment location at start of or six months prior to contract.
Total amount of contract associated with training.

Total cost of contract which includes the training fund, as well as, college administrative fee (18.51%), state administrative fee (1%), reserve fund amount (varies among community colleges), cost of issuance fees (3.9% includes bond counsel fee, financial advisor fee, rating agency fee, printing fee, other legal fees, etc.)
City associated with the employment location.
Indicates whether contract was associated with a new industry or an expanding industry.
Preliminary agreement date for the contract.
Name of community college administering the bonds.
Code of industrial sector based on the North American Industrial Classification System.
Name of employer participating in program.
Number of new positions pledged at start of the contract.
Total actual expenditures from training fund by record date.  Information may not be available for all contracts, especially new contracts.
Date at start of contract employer estimated project to be complete.
Zipcode associated with the employment location.
County associated with the employment location.
Indicates whether employer defaulted on contract.
Unique number assigned to the contract.

resource.description: The 12 business groups identified by business class codes in Iowa
resource.attribution: Iowa Department of Revenue
columns_description: Percent of tax is the ratio of computed tax to the total state computed tax for the quarter. The County totals include suppressed totals.

Computed retail sales tax filed in the quarter by the businesses identified in the business group.  An "S" represents suppression.  Computed tax sales is suppressed if there are less than 5 returns filed in the business group in the quarter. The County totals include suppressed totals.
Name of the one of the 12 business groups classifications

Number of returns filed in the quarter by the businesses identified in the business group.  An "S" represents suppression.  The number of returns is suppressed if there are less than 5 returns filed in the business group in the quarter.

Retail Taxable sales filed in the quarter by the businesses identified in the business group.  An "S" represents suppression.  Taxable sales is suppressed if there are less than 5 returns filed in the business group in the quarter. The County totals include suppressed totals.

resource.name: Residential Service Contract Companies Licensed in Iowa
resource.description:
A residential service contract company agrees to maintain, repair or replace structural components, appliances or electrical, plumbing, heating, cooling or air-conditioning systems or provide expense reimbursements in residential properties containing not more than four dwelling units.

The residential service contract company that issues the residential service contract and is obligated to arrange for the performance of services must be licensed with the Iowa Insurance Division.

This dataset provides a list of residential service contract companies that are licensed with the Iowa Insurance Division
resource.attribution: Iowa Department of Insurance & Financial Services, Insurance

domain_metadata.value: Data is updated periodically as needed.

Categorizes education completed by offender into three categories: Post-Secondary, HS Diploma or Equivalent, and No HS Diploma.  Post-Secondary includes the following: In College, Freshman level college, Sophomore level college,  Junior level college, Vocational/Technical Student, Technical Training Completion, Vocational Program/Technical Certificate, Associate's Degree, Bachelor's Degree, Master's Degree, and Doctorate.  HS Diploma or Equivalent includes the following: High School Diploma, HiSET/GED and Special Education Diploma.  No HS Diploma includes: First through Twelfth, No Diploma/No Certificate, Now Attending, and Unknown.

resource.name: Iowa Unemployment Insurance Claimants by Race and Ethnicity (Monthly)
resource.description: Characteristics of the Insured Unemployed. This dataset provides information on the race and ethnicity composition of unemployment insurance claimants. The data are based on those who file a continued claim in the week containing the 19th of the month, which reflects unemployment during the week containing the 12th. This corresponds with the Bureau of Labor Statistics' Current Population Survey. (Source: ETA-203)
resource.attribution: Iowa Workforce Development - Labor Market Information
columns_name: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander
columns_description: Asian
Stored as month ending date. Displayed as month.
Information Not Available

American Indian or Alaska Native
Number of unemployment insurance claimants filing continued claims during the week of the 19th of each month
Black or African American
Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

domain_metadata.value: Data is based on the Characteristics of the Insured Unemployed report (ETA-203).  This information is collected on the UI initial claims application and is self-identified.  Providing race and ethnic information is optional.

Data represents continued claims for the week including the 19th of the month. The dataset includes Regular Unemployment Insurance (UI). The dataset does not include Unemployment Compensation for Federal Employees (UCFE), Unemployment Compensation for Ex-service members (UCX), Voluntary Shared Work and temporary extensions such as Extended Benefits (EB) and Emergency Unemployment Compensation (EUC).
Available around the 20th of the following month.

resource.name: Levy Authority Rates in Iowa by Fiscal Year
resource.description: This dataset contains property tax rates for all levy authorities within the State of Iowa by fiscal year.  Property tax rates are the dollars collected per $1,000 in a property's taxable value. The state fiscal year runs from July 1 to the following June 30 and is numbered for the calendar year in which it ends.  Rates for a fiscal year are based on the taxable property valuations for the preceding calendar year (e.g. FY 2014 rates are based on 2012 taxable property valuations).
resource.attribution: Iowa Department of Management, Local Budget and Finance
columns_description: Rate applied to the levy authority's debt
Rate applied to property considered urban
A seven-digit Federal Information Processing Series code to ensure uniform identification of cities and other populated places
Name of the county the levy authority is located.  Not provided for levy authority types that can be in multiple counties (e.g. cities and school districts).
A five-digit Federal Information Processing Series code to ensure uniform identification of counties
Name of the levy authority
Unique ID for the levy authority
Category of levy authorities.
The state fiscal year runs from July 1 to the following June 30 and is numbered for the calendar year in which it ends.
An identifier to denote unique lines of data.
Rate applied to property considered rural
A ten-digit Federal Information Processing Series code to ensure uniform identification of county subdivisions
Name of city the levy authority is located where applicable.

resource.name: Annual Personal Consumption Expenditures for State of Iowa
resource.description:
This dataset provides annual estimates developed by the U.S. Bureau of Economic Analysis on consumer spending in the State of Iowa beginning in 1998.  Personal consumption expenditures (PCE) is the value of the goods and services purchased by, or on the behalf of, Iowa residents.  PCE is reported in millions of current dollars.  Also provided is per capita PCE which is reported in current dollars.  The Census Bureau’s annual midyear (July 1) population estimates are used for per capita variables.

Consumption category indicates the goods or services associated with personal consumption.  All includes both goods and services.

Goods include both durable goods and non durable goods.  Durable goods include: motor vehicles and parts, furnishings and durable household equipment, recreational goods and vehicles, and other durable goods.  Non durable goods include: food and beverages purchased for off-premises consumption, clothing and footwear, gasoline and other energy goods, and other non durable goods.

Services include household consumption expenditures (for services) and final consumption expenditures of nonprofit institutions serving households (NPISHs).  Household consumption expenditures include: housing and utilities, health care, transportation services, recreation services, food services and accommodations, financial services and insurance, and other services.  NPISH is the gross output of nonprofit institutions less receipts from sales of goods and services by nonprofit institutions.
resource.attribution: U.S. Department of Commerce, Bureau of Economic Analysis (SAPCE1, SAPCE2, SAEXP1, and SAEXP2))
columns_name: Rating Areas for Iowa Individual Affordable Care Act Premiums
columns_description: Unique identifier for the variable reported
Date the annual period ended that the reported value is for
Units associated with the value reported
Value reported for the time period
Prior year associated with the record.  Used for purposes of calculating percent change.
Year associated with the reported value.

Consumption category indicates the goods or services associated with personal consumption.  All includes both goods and services.  Goods include both durable goods and non durable goods.  Durable goods include: motor vehicles and parts, furnishings and durable household equipment, recreational goods and vehicles, and other durable goods.  Non durable goods include: food and beverages purchased for off-premises consumption, clothing and footwear, gasoline and other energy goods, and other non durable goods.  Services include household consumption expenditures (for services) and final consumption expenditures of nonprofit institutions serving households (NPISHs).  Household consumption expenditures include: housing and utilities, health care, transportation services, recreation services, food services and accommodations, financial services and insurance, and other services.  NPISH is the gross output of nonprofit institutions less receipts from sales of goods and services by nonprofit institutions.
Description of the variable
Unique row identifier for the variable and time period

domain_metadata.value: Values should not be aggregated across multiple variables or time periods.  Values of variables beginning with SAEXP1 should not be combined with those beginning with SAPCE1.  Values of variables beginning with SAEXP2 should not be combined with those beginning with SAPCE2.
See license.  See also methodologies used for the U.S. BEA data: https://www.bea.gov/resources/methodologies.
New data is available annually, but has a ten month time lag.  Corrections may be provided more frequently.  Data is updated using BEA's API.

resource.name: Iowa Board of Regents' Vendor Payments by Institution, Fiscal Year And Vendor
resource.description: The dataset provides aggregate payments made Iowa Board of Regents to vendors by institution and fiscal year starting with FY 2012.  Payments made by the Board of Regents are assigned to fiscal years that run from July 1 to the following June 30, and are numbered for the calendar year in which they end (e.g. FY 2014 is July 1, 2013 – June 30, 2014).
resource.attribution: Iowa Board of Regents
columns_description: Fiscal year payment was assigned to.  As the State of Iowa operates on modified cash basis of budgeting, the fiscal year includes a hold-over period for payments made after year end for good and services received on or before June 30.
Aggregated total payments received by vendor in the fiscal year
Name of university or special school making the payment
Name of vendor receiving the payment

domain_metadata.value: Data is updated annually.  Updates are available after close of fiscal year.

resource.name: City Population in Iowa by County and Year
resource.description: This dataset contains city population in Iowa from 2010 to the most current year available. Data from 2010 comes from the decennial census while the proceeding years are produced annually. Aggregating the city populations in each county will provide a county total population
resource.attribution: U.S. Census Bureau, Population Division, 301-763-2422
columns_name: Rating Areas for Iowa Individual Affordable Care Act Premiums
columns_description: County FIP – A five-digit code for counties based on Federal Information Processing Standards Publication - FIPS 55-DC3 (December 1994) , Guideline: Codes for Named Populated Places, Primary County Divisions, and Other Locational Entities of the United States, Puerto Rico, and the Outlying Areas (withdrawn February 8, 2005)
Primary latitude and longitude in decimal degrees for the city or county.  Latitude and longitude are based on values provided by USGS's Geographic Names Information System.
For population estimates the date of reference is always July 1. The decennial census has a date of April 1.

domain_metadata.value: Caution is urged in making year-to-year comparisons of population estimates. When the Census Bureau releases new population estimates for the current year, it also revises estimates for previous years in the decade. Aggregating multiple years is discouraged

resource.name: Iowa Unemployment Insurance Benefit Payments and UI Recipients by County (Annual)
resource.description: This dataset contains Iowa unemployment insurance benefit payments, weeks compensated, and number of benefit recipients by county. County data is based on the recipient’s place of residence.
resource.attribution: Iowa Workforce Development - Labor Market Information Division
columns_description: Primary longitude in decimal degrees for the county as provided by U.S. Geological Survey, 19810501, U.S. Geographic Names Information System (GNIS): U.S. Geological Survey, Reston, VA.
Primary latitude in decimal degrees for the county as provided by U.S. Geological Survey, 19810501, U.S. Geographic Names Information System (GNIS): U.S. Geological Survey, Reston, VA.
ID for county provided by U.S. Geographic Names Information System (GNIS): U.S. Geological Survey, Reston, VA. County based on recipients place of residence.
A five-digit Federal Information Processing Series code to ensure uniform identification of counties. Code based on recipients place of residence.
Number of claimants residing in the county drawing the final payment of their original entitlement of UI (exhaustees).
The number of claimants residing in the county receiving their the first payment in a benefit year for a week of unemployment claimed under the state UI program.

The number of claimants residing in the county receiving at least one UI benefit during the year.  The recipients column cannot be summed over multiple years. Summing multiple years will cause a duplicate count since some recipients will be be counted in more than one year.
Unemployment benefits paid to individuals residing in the county under the state UI program for the year
County recipients reside
Year for unemployment claims and payments
The number of weeks claimed by recipients residing in county for which UI benefits are paid. Weeks compensated for partial unemployment are included.
Primary coordinate for the county in decimal degrees.

domain_metadata.value: The recipients column cannot be summed over multiple years. Summing multiple years will cause a duplicate count since some recipients will be be counted in more than one year.  Statewide totals will not match the official US Department of Labor reports (ETA-5159).

The dataset includes the following programs: Regular Unemployment Insurance (UI), Unemployment Compensation for Federal Employees (UCFE), Unemployment Compensation for Ex-servicemembers (UCX), and Voluntary Shared Work. The dataset does not include temporary extensions such as Extended Benefits (EB) and Emergency Unemployment Compensation (EUC). This data does not include benefits paid to persons living outside of Iowa (such as commuter claims from neighboring states).
This data is updated annually.  Updates are typically available in January.

resource.name: Iowa Liquor Stores
resource.description: This dataset provides a list of active and inactive liquor stores in Iowa.
resource.attribution: Iowa Department of Revenue, Alcoholic Beverages
columns_description: Indicates whether the store is active (A) or inactive (I).
State the store is located
Zip code for the store location.
Address for the store
Name of the store

Location of store. The Address, City, State and Zip Code are geocoded to provide geographic coordinates. Accuracy of geocoding is dependent on how well the address is interpreted and the completeness of the reference data used.
City the store is located
Unique number for each store.
Date the report was ran

This column was automatically created in order to record in what polygon from the dataset 'County Boundaries of Iowa' (y683-txed) the point in column 'store_address' is located.  This enables the creation of region maps (choropleths) in the visualization canvas and data lens.

domain_metadata.value: Data is updated monthly.  Updates are typically available first of the month.

resource.name: Top 20 Fiscal Year 2017 Sales and Use Tax Expenditures
resource.description: The Top Twenty Sales and Use tax expenditures
resource.attribution: Iowa Department of Revenue

resource.name: Pharmacy Benefit Managers
resource.description: A pharmacy benefits manager performs pharmacy benefits management services for an entity offering pharmacy benefits to their customers.  Pharmacy benefits manager does not include a health insurer licensed in the state if the health insurer or its subsidiary is providing pharmacy benefits management services exclusively to its own insureds, or a public self-funded pool or a private single employer self-funded plan that provides such benefits or services directly to its beneficiaries.
resource.attribution: Iowa Department of Insurance & Financial Services, Insurance

resource.name: Distribution of Funds to Non-Entitlement Units of Local Government in Iowa
resource.description:
The U.S. Department of the Treasury through Coronavirus Local Fiscal Recovery Fund provided a critical source of relief for smaller local governments, many of which have not received direct fiscal assistance from the federal government since the onset of the COVID-19 pandemic.  Non-entitlement units of local government (NEUs) are cities serving populations less than 50,000.  The State of Iowa is responsible for distributing these funds to NEUs within Iowa.  Award amounts are based on the population of the NEU.

Distributions from the Local Fiscal Recovery Fund to state, then subsequently NEUs are being done in two tranches.  The first tranche was done in 2021, and the second in 2022.
resource.attribution: Iowa Department of Management
columns_description: Sum total of first tranche allocation and reallocation payments
Funds allocated to the city as part of the first tranche in 2021
Sum of original allocation and reallocation adjustment.

Allocation the city is eligible to receive from first and second tranche based on the following formula: (Total population of the NEU/Total population of all eligible NEUs) X Aggregate state NEU payment

The city's status regarding NEU allocation.  Status is one of the following: Submitted - Participated, Submitted - Transfer to State, Reallocation - No Response, and Reallocation - Requested Transfer to NEUs
Payment made to the city based on the second tranche allocation

Additional payment made as part of a reallocation of funds from the first tranche.  Reallocations were made in instances where a city remained unresponsive after reasonable efforts to contact them, or have declined the funding.
Payment made to the city based on the first tranche allocation
Population estimate used for allocating funds
Name of the city being allocated funding
Unique identifier created for the city
Reallocation adjustment made based on the status of the city.

domain_tags: state and local fiscal recovery fund

resource.name: Demographics
resource.description: A SHSP (Strategic Highway Safety Plan) is a statewide-coordinated safety plan that provides a comprehensive framework for reducing highway fatalities and serious injuries on all public roads. The SHSP strategically establishes statewide goals, objectives and key emphasis areas developed in consultation with federal, state, local and private sector safety stakeholders. The SHSP plan process is a requirement of the Federal Highway Administration's Highway Safety Improvement Program (HSIP). In general, the federal HSIP requires that state transportation departments develop an SHSP that: includes consultation from a variety of stakeholders during the development process, analyzes and makes effective use of crash data, addresses the 5Es (engineering, enforcement, education, emergency services and everyone) plus management and operations, considers the safety needs of all public roads, describes a program of projects or strategies to reduce or eliminate safety hazards, is implemented and evaluated.  This dataset provides county population change information, and percent of county population working outside county of residence that is used for most current SHSP.
resource.attribution: Iowa Department of Transportation, Planning, Programming and Modal Division, Systems Planning Bureau
columns_name: Percent Working Outside County of Residence

resource.name: 4% Housing Tax Credits Awards

resource.name: Iowa Population by Hispanic or Latino Origin and Race (ACS 5-Year Estimates)
resource.description:
This dataset contains Iowa population by Hispanic or Latino Origin, and race for State of Iowa, individual Iowa counties, Iowa places and census tracts within Iowa.  Data is from the American Community Survey, Five Year Estimates, Table B03002.

Hispanic includes total, yes and no.  Yes = Hispanic or Latino; No = Not Hispanic or Latino

Race includes: White Alone, Black or African American Alone, American Indian and Alaska Native, Asian Alone, Native Hawaiian and Other Pacific Islander Alone, Some Other Race, Two or More Races, and Two Races Excluding Some Other Race and Three or More Races.
resource.attribution: U.S. Census Bureau, American Community Survey
columns_description: Percent change from the previous five year data collection period.
Population estimate associated with geography, variable, and data collection period.
Variable name identified by the US Census Bureau.
Name of geography associated with the record.
Specific geography id used by the U.S. Census for the state, county, place or census tract associated with the record.
The date when the 60 month data collection period concluded.
The data collection period reflects the years associated with the 60 month data collection period.
Describes the characteristics associated with the variable.

Race includes Total, White Alone, Black or African American Alone, American Indian and Alaska Native, Asian Alone, Native Hawaiian and Other Pacific Islander Alone, Some Other Race, Two or More Races, and Two Races Excluding Some Other Race and Three or More Races.
Primary point for the specific geography.
Hispanic includes total, yes and no.  Yes = Hispanic or Latino; No = Not Hispanic or Latino
Specifies the type of geography associated with the record. Categories include: state, county, place and tract.
